speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: SCENE II. Corioli. The Senate-house.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Enter TULLUS AUFIDIUS and certain Senators

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: So, your opinion is, Aufidius,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: That they of Rome are entered in our counsels

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: And know how we proceed.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Is it not yours?

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: What ever have been thought on in this state,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: That could be brought to bodily act ere Rome

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Had circumvention? 'Tis not four days gone

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Since I heard thence; these are the words: I think

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: I have the letter here; yes, here it is.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Reads

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: 'They have press'd a power, but it is not known

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Whether for east or west: the dearth is great;

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: The people mutinous; and it is rumour'd,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Cominius, Marcius your old enemy,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Who is of Rome worse hated than of you,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: And Titus Lartius, a most valiant Roman,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: These three lead on this preparation

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Whither 'tis bent: most likely 'tis for you:

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Consider of it.'

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Our army's in the field

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: We never yet made doubt but Rome was ready

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: To answer us.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Nor did you think it folly

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: To keep your great pretences veil'd till when

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: They needs must show themselves; which

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: in the hatching,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: It seem'd, appear'd to Rome. By the discovery.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: We shall be shorten'd in our aim, which was

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: To take in many towns ere almost Rome

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Should know we were afoot.

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Noble Aufidius,

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Take your commission; hie you to your bands:

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Let us alone to guard Corioli:

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: If they set down before 's, for the remove

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Bring your army; but, I think, you'll find

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: They've not prepared for us.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: O, doubt not that;

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: I speak from certainties. Nay, more,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Some parcels of their power are forth already,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: And only hitherward. I leave your honours.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: If we and Caius Marcius chance to meet,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: 'Tis sworn between us we shall ever strike

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Till one can do no more.

speaker: All
text_entry: The gods assist you!

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: And keep your honours safe!

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Farewell.

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Farewell.

speaker: All
text_entry: Farewell.

speaker: All
text_entry: Exeunt
